post_text:
While many of the surrounding districts will begin the school year with full remote (virtual) instruction until October, our school will move forward and operate with 3 learning options (traditional, hybrid, and virtual) as scheduled unless we are directed by the governor differently.

Due to the governor's ongoing changes, we have decided to delay our in-person learning( traditional/hybrid) option until September 8th.

Finally, teachers will finish their welcome calls by weekâ€™s end to provide you with additional information.

Thank you.

Finally, teachers will finish their welcome calls by weekâ€™s end to provide you with additional information.

Thank you.

post_text:
Never Miss a Facebook Post from Our School

Have you noticed a change in your Facebook news feed? Iâ€™m betting you have, as Facebook has made some significant changes. These alterations impact the stories, photos and videos that are showing up for Facebook users.

That being said, we know you want to stay connected to the awesome things that are happening at our school. So here are three simple steps you can take to make sure you never miss an update!

Go to your schoolâ€™s Facebook page. You can do this on your desktop or mobile device by typing in the name of the page in the search bar within Facebook.

Once you are at your schoolâ€™s page, find the â€œFollowingâ€ tab under the cover image and click on the small arrow next to it.
On the desktop it looks like this image:

On your mobile device, it will look similar to image :

post_text:
Smaller class sizes are always a priority at Bridgeton Public Charter School! BPCS is a tuition-free Kindergarten through Fourth-grade school that offers class sizes that average about 15 students per class. In keeping with the New Jersey Social Distancing guidelines and the studentsâ€™ health and safety our priority, we currently have spots available for Grades K-4. We are in our planning phase for the upcoming school year and will be offering different types of learning environments to meet the needs of our students and families.

We are currently offering many enrollment incentives. Please contact us for more information and to secure a spot at Bridgeton Public Charter School.

Phone: 856-506-8143 - Email: ahilliard@cccharters.org

BPCS Student Registration Form:

https://forms.gle/HGNSAnK6Zhp6rxQJ8

post_text:
Parents and Guardians,

VPCS/BPCS/MPCS is offering a Summer Meal Program with pick up service at MPCS for the entire summer. The meals are on a first-come, first-serve basis for children 18 and under in the Cumberland County areas. In addition, if you have neighbors in need of meals, you are welcomed to pick up lunch for them as well. We will provide free meals every Monday and Wednesday from 11:30 AM -1:00 PM.

Thank you and we wish you a safe and enjoyable summer.
text:
Parents and Guardians,

VPCS/BPCS/MPCS is offering a Summer Meal Program with pick up service at MPCS for the entire summer. The meals are on a first-come, first-serve basis for children 18 and under in the Cumberland County areas. In addition, if you have neighbors in need of meals, you are welcomed to pick up lunch for them as well. We will provide free meals every Monday and Wednesday from 11:30 AM -1:00 PM.

Thank you and we wish you a safe and enjoyable summer.
Kindergarten Graduation BPCS

post_text:
Life is a beautiful garden;
Each teacher is a flower,
Who fills our lives with knowledge
And teaches us every hour.

They fill our lives with knowledge,
Smiles and patience too;
Your flower is very treasured;
It's special just like you.

You're always there to teach
Learning that has no end,
Believing in my dreams
As teacher and also friend.

Parents:

Tomorrow is a food pick up day.
We will be implementing a new pick up procedure.

We have been directed not to allow our food service workers to come within six feet of your cars.
1. When you pull up, we will ask how many meals you are picking up.
2. There will be a table that the meals will be place. Please remain in your car until the Food service worker clears the area.

post_text:
After consulting with the Cumberland County Department of Health and while there are still no confirmed cases of COVID-19 in Cumberland County, we have made the decision to close our schools effective Tuesday, March 17, 2020.

Bridgeton Public Charter School will remain closed until after spring break, April 20th. We will continue to monitor this changing situation and consult with the Cumberland County Department of Health, County Department of Education and the Office of the Governor to determine if remote learning needs to be modified.

Please share!ï¿¼

After consulting with the Cumberland County Department of Health and while there are still no confirmed cases of COVID-19 in Cumberland County, we have made the decision to close our schools effective Tuesday, March 17, 2020.

Bridgeton Public Charter School will remain closed until after spring break, April 20th. We will continue to monitor this changing situation and consult with the Cumberland County Department of Health, County Department of Education and the Office of the Governor to determine if remote learning needs to be modified.

post_text:
Please be advised of the following updated district information in regards to COVID-19:

School events are now limited to 250 occupants.

No out of state student trips are permitted.

Bridgeton Public Charter School will remain open unless otherwise recommended by the health department.

Currently our teachers are preparing for online learning for students to familiarize themselves with Google classroom. This will allow teachers to reach and instruct students in the event of a school closure. Information and resources will be sent home on Monday.

PLEASE REMEMBER: This information is subject to change at any time. We will share new information as we receive it.

https://www.cdc.gov/coronavirus/2019-ncov/index.html

post_text:
Teachers get to spend more time with our kids than we do. They are an important person in a child's life and a role model. A good one is worth their weight in gold!

Great teachers are the people who make a lasting impact on our lives. Whether theyâ€™re teaching from a textbook or sharing some of lifeâ€™s most important lessons, those who make it their mission to educate deserve recognition and appreciation. By taking the time to express your gratitude for a teacher, youâ€™ll let them know how much their hard work truly means to you.

MAKE SURE YOU SHARE THIS POST WITH YOUR TEACHERS!!!

post_text: Today at BPCS the students were able experience what it was like to travel to Ellis Island. They traveled with their paperwork and passports around the island and got to experience the different tests that were given when people came to the island. The grades that participated were 2nd through 4th grade.

post_text: Charter Awareness Week is less than one week away! As proud parents, we ALL need to make our voices heard on behalf of our kids and our schools. While some parents will be engaging with elected leaders starting on April 8, there are opportunities to interact on social media with elected officials that support our school, and the chance to connect with hundreds of NJ public charter school families.

Modell's Spring Shopping Event!

You can shop at any Modell's Location or Online and either show the coupon or use the online code and you will

receive a 15% discount on your entire purchase including sale, clearance and regular price items.

This is a great way to pick up your Spring Clothing, New Footwear, League Baseball Gear or your favorite Team Gear like Phillies, Sixers, Eagles and Flyers as well as all the other teams and save while you are at it!

post_text:
Like you, Iâ€™m a proud New Jersey public charter school supporter. We represent our kids who are part of the 52,000 public charter school students across the state getting a top-notch education.

As proud PUBLIC school parents, we need to do more and speak out on behalf of our kids and their schools. We need to make sure that our elected leaders know that charter schools are public schools and ensure that weâ€™re treated and funded fairly.

Thatâ€™s why weâ€™re participating in Charter Awareness Week! For ONE week in April (April 8-12), we want your help to raise awareness and support for public charter schools in New Jersey.

post_text: Lions KidSight USA Foundation is a nationwide program to safeguard the vision of children, concentrating on kids aged 6 months through 6 years. Their mission is to ensure eye screening and follow-up care is given to all kids because every child deserves to learn and see the world clearly. Thanks for visiting us!
